title: Best Prime Day Kitchen Deals Still Available: KitchenAid, Ninja, Keurig and More
description: Even though Prime Day has ended, there are still plenty of kitchen deals to take advantage of. We've put together a list of some of the best.
author: Adrian Marlow
excerpt: Even though Prime Day has ended, there are still plenty of kitchen deals to take advantage of. We've put together a list of some of the best.

How does CNET select the best October Prime Day deals?Our team of expert shoppers and deal hunters has spent years helping buyers understand which major sales and deals are legitimately good and which are more routine. That includes Black Friday, Prime Day, Memorial Day and countless other shopping events. We've gotten very good at weeding out scams and superficial deals on appliances of every kind so you see only the best offers. At CNET, we look for real discounts, quality reviews and remaining sale time when choosing a deal to show you. Real discounts mean exactly that. We look at the price history for that product to make sure no manufacturers are inflating prices to make the discount seem more substantial than it is.Quality reviews are important for any product, but especially for deeply discounted items. An appliance is a big investment, and if you don't get enough mileage out of it, the discount isn't worthwhile. Remaining sale time is a huge part of our vetting process. The good news, however, is that Amazon offers a 30-day free trial for Prime, so you can still take full advantage of Prime Day without any commitment. Some deals are available for non-members too, and we include those in our roundups as well.
html:
Why You Can Trust CNET

Our expert deal-hunting staff showcases the best price drops and discounts from reputable sellers daily. If you make a purchase using our links, CNET may earn a commission.

Even though Prime Day has ended, there are still plenty of kitchen deals to take advantage of. We've put together a list of some of the best.

Adrian is a deals writer on the Commerce team at CNET. With a love of books, entertainment, travel, tabletop games and, yes, even fandom, they can often be found at concerts, RenFest, Dragon Con or at home binge-watching everything from new hits to classics. After graduating from Kennesaw State with a B.A. in English and Professional Writing, Adrian had a short gig in casting, followed by a long stint teaching English lit, theater and film, before transitioning into commerce writing in 2021. Adrian enjoys sharing insights and favorite finds with their readers.

Expertise Deals

Amber Guetebier Writer

When not writing up the best deals for CNET readers, Amber Guetebier writes about plants, gardening, folklore and pirates. She is the author of several books and currently writing several more.

$60 at Amazon

Keurig K-Express single serve K-pod coffee maker: $60

Save $30

$1,800 at Best Buy

LG counter-depth 16.5-cubic-foot French door refrigerator: $1,800

Save $700

$600 at Best Buy

De'Longhi Magnifica Evo coffee and espresso machine: $600

Save $200

With holiday cooking and baking on the horizon, now is the perfect time to upgrade your kitchen appliances -- and there are plenty of deals to cash in on right now. Even after the two-day mega shopping event, Amazon's October Prime Day has ended, you can still save hundreds on lingering sales. From pizza ovens to double-door refrigerators, these last-minute savings can help you revamp your kitchen without breaking the bank.

In other words, you still have a chance to take advantage of deals like $200 off a fancy De'Longhi coffee and espresso maker. The discounts are not going to last long, though, so act fast if you see something you want.

Hey, did you know? CNET Deals texts are free, easy and save you money. 

CNET's team of expert shoppers has been working on sales events like Prime Day for years, knowing exactly where to find the best kitchen deals and more importantly, which "deals" to skip. Figuring out the difference between a ho-hum discount and a genuine good deal is crucial for the best shopping experience.

We've gathered the best deals available on Amazon and at other competitive retailers, including Home Depot and Best Buy. We'll keep this page updated as new offers crop up and disappear. Keep scrolling to see all the best lingering Prime Day kitchen appliance deals we've found.

Best post-Prime Day kitchen deals

This eight-in-one outdoor pizza oven allows you to roast, bake, smoke, barbecue and more. Right now, it's $100 less than the regular price. If you're planning to use it for your outdoor adventures, consider pairing it with a Ninja cooler with a drawer to keep your drinks chilled as you bake.

This 0.7-cubic-foot, energy-efficient microwave gets the job done without hogging all your counter space. It's currently discounted by 10%.

Get your caffeine fix on the quick with this single-serve K-pod coffee maker that has three brew sizes and a 42-ounce reservoir.

If you're tired of having a refrigerator that sticks out past the edge of your countertops, opt for one like this counter-depth smart fridge with side-by-side French doors and a bottom-drawer freezer.

Espresso or a perfect cup of brew? This deluxe machine has a built-in grinder and a one-touch digital display so you can choose whatever coffee drink suits your mood. Plus, it's got the LatteCrema system, which foams milk to perfection.

If you are always (or mostly) on the go, this Ninja Blast portable blender can be a great travel companion. It looks like a water bottle and can blend both fresh and frozen items perfectly with minimal noise. Once your drink is ready, you can use the slip lid to drink it from the same vessel. It can even fit in your car's cup holder.

More post-Prime Day kitchen deals

  • Whirlpool over-the-range microwave: $210 (save $150). This stainless steel model has convenient presets.
  • LG side-by-side smart refrigerator: $1,600 (save $500). You'll get a free $150 gift card thrown in. Plus, this model has a massive 27-cubic-foot capacity and craft ice.
  • Samsung Bespoke 29-cubic-foot French door smart refrigerator: $2,298 (save $1,101). This 4-door refrigerator with a beverage center is a whopping 32% off.
  • LG French door smart refrigerator: $1,700 (save $700). This 3-door refrigerator has a capacity of over 27 cubic feet and an external ice and water dispenser. Plus, it comes with a free $200 gift card.
  • LG 24-inch top control dishwasher: $850 (save $450). You'll get a $100 gift card when you buy this dishwasher with top control and a third rack.
  • De'Longhi coffee maker and espresso machine: $220 (save $100). Make specialty drinks at home with this impressive device.
  • Ninja 13-in-1 toaster oven: $180 (save $105). This versatile oven can air fry, bake, broil, toast, dehydrate and more. It even has a smart thermometer.
  • ThermoPro TempSpike Bluetooth meat thermometer: $60 (save $40). This wireless thermometer helps you keep track of your meat even when you're watching the game.
  • Crock-Pot portable electric lunchbox: $35 (save $10). Keep your food warm on the go with this easy-to-carry crockpot.
  • Kitchen Mama automatic electric can opener: $30 (save $5). A battery-operated portable can opener with a smooth edge.
  • KitchenAid oven mitt set: $20 (save $15). These ribbed soft silicone mitts are at their lowest price yet.
  • McCook Knife Set stainless steel: $91 (save $39). An all-in-one knife set with a block and sharpener.
  • KitchenAid 5 Ultra Power hand mixer: $45 (save $15). Mix ingredients in no time with 5-speed settings included.
  • Ninja Creami ice cream maker: $200 (save $30). Make ice cream, gelato, smoothie bowls, milkshakes and more.
  • KitchenAid Artisan Mini 3.5-quart stand mixer: $300 (save $80): Get ready for holiday baking with this space-saving mini stand mixer.

Watch this: How to Hack Amazon Prime Day: Shopping and Deals Advice

04:03

What appliances can I save on with Prime Day sales?

During -- and even for a short period after -- Prime Day, you can find solid deals on everything from refrigerators to ovens to dishwashers and much more, including great deals on a number of small appliances from top brands. While Amazon has great options available, especially on coffee makers, air fryers and similar items, you'll also find competing anti-Prime sales at competitors like Home Depot and Best Buy.

How does CNET select the best October Prime Day deals?

Our team of expert shoppers and deal hunters has spent years helping buyers understand which major sales and deals are legitimately good and which are more routine. That includes Black Friday, Prime Day, Memorial Day and countless other shopping events. We've gotten very good at weeding out scams and superficial deals on appliances of every kind so you see only the best offers. 

At CNET, we look for real discounts, quality reviews and remaining sale time when choosing a deal to show you. 

  • Real discounts mean exactly that. We look at the price history for that product to make sure no manufacturers are inflating prices to make the discount seem more substantial than it is.
  • Quality reviews are important for any product, but especially for deeply discounted items. An appliance is a big investment, and if you don't get enough mileage out of it, the discount isn't worthwhile. 
  • Remaining sale time is a huge part of our vetting process. If a deal is likely to be short-lived or limited to remaining stock, we'll let you know upfront -- so you're not disappointed if you check back later and find it's gone.

Do I have to be a Prime member to get kitchen appliance deals during Prime Day events?

Many of the deals you'll find during Prime Day events are exclusively for Prime members. The good news, however, is that Amazon offers a 30-day free trial for Prime, so you can still take full advantage of Prime Day without any commitment. Some deals are available for non-members too, and we include those in our roundups as well.
